CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Afghani/US$. The first Afghani was introduced in 1925. Though the exchange rate has been freely determined most of the time, for some periods, a dual exchange rate regime existed: an official exchange rate fixed by the Afghan Central Bank, and a free market exchange rate. The gap between the official and free-market exchange rates widened in the 1980s and during the civil war. Since 2002, a floating exchange rate regime has been adopted.
GENERAL_NOTES: Afghanistan is a landlocked country in Southern Asia. It is bordered by Pakistan to the south and the east, Iran to the west, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan and Tajikistan to the north, and China to the northeast.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in lek/US$. Since July 1992, a floating exchange rate system has been adopted. However authorities intervene to smooth the fluctuations.
GENERAL_NOTES: Albania is a transition country in South Eastern Europe. It is bordered by Montenegro to the northwest, Kosovo to the northeast, the Republic of Macedonia to the east and Greece to the south and southeast. Albania is a member of the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe, Council of Europe, Organisation of the Islamic Conference and one of the founding members of the Union for the Mediterranean. Albania applied for European Union membership on April 2009.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Algerian Dinar/US$. By 2005, the rate is determined by a system of managed float with no pre-determined path. However before that, the rate was on a fixed relationship between the dinar and a composite of currencies.
GENERAL_NOTES: Algeria is in North Africa. Algeria is bordered in the northeast by Tunisia, in the east by Libya, in the west by Morocco, in the southwest by Western Sahara, Mauritania, and Mali, in the southeast by Niger, and in the north by the Mediterranean Sea. It is a member of OPEC.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Kwanza/ US$. Since 1977, four different currencies named kwanza have circulated. In 1977, Kwanza replaced the Angolan escudo (1 kwanza = 1 Angolan escudo). In 1990, Kwanza was replaced by novo Kwanza (1 novo kwanza = 1 kwanza). In 1995, novos kwanzas was replaced by Kwanza.
GENERAL_NOTES: Angola is a country in Southern Africa bordered by Namibia on the south, the Democratic Republic of the Congo on the north, and Zambia on the east, the Atlantic Ocean on the west. The exclave province of Cabinda shares borders with the Republic of the Congo and the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is a member the African Union, the Community of Portuguese Language Countries, the Latin Union and the Southern African Development Community. After received its independence in 1975, the country faced a civil war lasted until 2002.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Since 1976, the rate has been pegged to the United States: US$1 = East Caribbean Dollar $2.70.
GENERAL_NOTES: Antigua and Barbuda is a island nation lying between the Caribbean Sea and the Atlantic Ocean. It consists of two major islands, Antigua and Barbuda, and a number of smaller islands. The islands became an independent state as a Commonwealth Realm system on November, 1981. It is a member of CARICOM

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Argentina Peso/ US$. Throughout the history, Argentina has been in a process of devaluation of its currency and has adopted several exchange rate regimes. From January 1, 1970, the peso ley equal to 100 peso moneda nacional was introduced. On June 1983, the peso argentino equal to 10,000 peso ley was introduced. The austral equal to 1,000 peso argentino was introduced on June 1985. However on January, 1992 the peso, equal to 10,000 australes, was introduced. After the financial crisis in 2001, the fixed exchange rate system was abolished. By the end of 2001, a new dual exchange regime was established: the Principal rate was an official exchange rate which was a fixed rate of 1.40 pesos per U.S. dollar for trade and financial transactions; and a Free Exchange Market rate for all other transactions. Currently, crawling_like arrangement for exchange rate is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Argentina borders Paraguay and Bolivia to the north, Brazil and Uruguay to the northeast, and Chile to the west and south the Atlantic Ocean to the east. Argentina is a founding member of both the United Nations, Mercosur and the Union of South American Nations. Argentina is one of the G-20 major economies.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Armenian Dram/ US$. Though the country became independent in 1991, the Soviet currency were legal tender until the end of 1993. The dram was introduced on November 1993, at a rate of 200 rubles = 1 dram. The dram is not pegged to any other currency.
GENERAL_NOTES: Armenia, a former republic of Soviet Union is a landlocked in the Eurasia bordered by Turkey to the west, Georgia to the north, the Nagorno-Karabakh Republic and Azerbaijan to the east, and Iran and the Azerbaijani exclave of Nakhchivan to the south.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Aruban Florin/US$. It is was pegged to US$ at the rate of 1 US $ = 1.79 Aruban Florin. The florin was introduced in 1986 to replace the Netherlands Antillean guilder at par. US dollar has been used as the alternative currency.
GENERAL_NOTES: Aruba is a constituent country of the Kingdom of the Netherlands. This is an island of the Lesser Antilles in the Caribbean Sea. Aruba and all Dutch Islands in the Antilles are commonly refer as Netherland Antilles or Dutch Antilles. Venezuela is the sea boundary to the south and Colombia is on the west.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Australian Dollar/US$. On December 1983, Australia adopted a free floating exchange rate regime.
GENERAL_NOTES: Australia is an island continent in the Southern Hemisphere. Neighbouring countries are Indonesia, East Timor and Papua New Guinea to the north, the Solomon Islands, Vanuatu and New Caledonia to the northeast and New Zealand to the southeast. Australia is a federal state. It is a member of G20, ANZUS, OECD, APEC, East Asia Summit and Pacific Islands Forum.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Euro/US$. Prior to January 1999, the exchange rate was determined by the mid point in the Vienna market. After the breakdown of Bretton Woods system, the schilling was tied to a basket of currencies. In 1999, Austria adopted the Euro at the rate of 1 Euro =13.7603 Schilling.
GENERAL_NOTES: Austria is a landlocked country of Central Europe. It borders Germany and the Czech Republic to the north, Slovakia and Hungary to the east, Slovenia and Italy to the south, and Switzerland and Liechtenstein to the west. Austria joined the European Union in 1995, and is a founder of the OECD. Austria also signed the Schengen Agreement in 1995. It is a member of G20 as well.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Azerbaijani Manat/ US$. The manat was introduced on August 1992 by replacing the Soviet ruble at a rate of 10 rubles to 1 manat. In 2006, a new manat was introduced at a value of 5,000 old manat. A stabilized arrangement is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Azerbaijan, is in the Caucasus region located at the crossroads of Western Asia and Eastern Europe border by the Caspian Sea to the east, Russia to the north, Georgia to the northwest, Armenia to the west and Iran to the south. The exclave of Nakhchivan is border by Armenia to the north and east, Iran to the south and west; Turkey to the northwest. It received its independence in 1991 from the Soviet Union. It holds membership in 38 international organizations.

CURRENCY_NOTES: The Bahamian dollar has been pegged to the U.S. dollar on a one-to-one basis. However a dual rate system exists. The principal rate is the official rate and the secondary rate is for the investment currency rate.
GENERAL_NOTES: It is in the Atlantic Ocean located north of Cuba and Dominican Republic and Haiti, northwest of the Turks and Caicos Islands, and southeast of the United States. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Bahraini dinar/ US$. Dinar was introduced in 1965, replacing the Gulf rupee ( 10 Gulf rupees = 1 dinar). This is pegged to U.S. dollar ( 0.376 Bahraini dinar per US$).
GENERAL_NOTES: Bahrain is an archipelago of small islands near the western shores of the Persian Gulf. Saudi Arabia lies to the west Iran to the north; Qatar to the southeast across the Gulf of Bahrain.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Bangladesh Taka /US$. In 1972, the taka replaced the Pakistani rupee. In 1970s the rate was pegged to the Pound and later it was changed and fixed to a composite basket of selected currencies. By 2005, it adopted a managed floating rate system. In addition On January 1992, the exchange rate system (the official and the secondary market rate) is unified.
GENERAL_NOTES: Bangladesh which received independence in 1971 is situated in South Asia. It is bordered by India on all sides except for a small border with Myanmar to the far southeast and by the Bay of Bengal to the south.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Barbados Dollar/US$. Since July 1975, the Barbados dollar has been pegged to the US dollar at the rate of US$1 = B. dollar 2.
GENERAL_NOTES: It is an Island nation located in the North Atlantic Ocean and northeast of Venezuela and the east of the islands of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Belarussian Ruble/ US$. After the collapse of the Soviet Union , both Soviet and the Belarusian rubles were circulated. However on May 1992, the first post-Soviet Belarusian ruble replaced the Soviet currency (1 Belarusian ruble = 10 Soviet rubles) . After two years, the Belarusian ruble became the official currency of the country. In 2000, a second Belarusian ruble replaced the first Belarusian ruble at a rate of 1 new Belarusian ruble = 1000 old Belarusian ruble.
GENERAL_NOTES: Belarus, a former state of Soviet Union, is a landlocked country in Eastern Europe bordered by Russia to the northeast, Ukraine to the south, Poland to the west, and Lithuania and Latvia to the northwest. Though it received independence, it continues policies of former Soviet Union.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Euro/US$. Prior to March 1990, a dual exchange rate system was adopted. The primary rate, maintained within the cooperative exchange arrangement under European monetary system (EMS) was for most transactions while the secondary, or a free market rate was for most capital transactions. From March 1990, the market rate within EMS was applied for all transactions, until the Belgium franc become a participatory currency within Euro system and the EURO market rate is applicable to all transactions at the rate of 1 Euro = 40.3399 Belgium Franc. From 2002, the Euro has become the official currency.
GENERAL_NOTES: Belgium is in northwest Europe. Belgium shares borders with France, Germany, Luxembourg and the Netherlands. It is a founding member of the European Union and hosts its headquarters, as well as those of other major international organizations, including NATO. It signed the Schengen agreement in 1995. It is a member of G-20 and OECD as well.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Belize Dollar (BZ$) /US$ which has been pegged at 2 Belize dollar = 1US$ since 1978.
GENERAL_NOTES: Belize is in Central America bordered by Mexico to the north, by Guatemala to the south and the west, and by the Caribbean Sea to the east. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in CFA franc/US$. Until 1999, the official rate was pegged to the French franc. In 1994, CFA franc was devalued (100 CFC franc = Franc franc). Since January 1999, CFC franc has been pegged to the Euro at the rate of 655.957 per Euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: Benin is a country in West Africa sharing borders with Togo to the west, Nigeria to the east and Burkina Faso and Niger to the north. It has small southern coastline on the Bight of Benin.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Bermudian dollar/US$. This has been pegged to the US dollar at par. US dollar is also excepted as a legal tender.
GENERAL_NOTES: Bermuda is an Island and a British overseas territory in the North Atlantic Ocean and located on the east coast of the United States. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Ngultrum/US$. The ngultrum was introduced 1974 replacing the rupee at par. This is pegged to Indian rupee at per.
GENERAL_NOTES: The Kingdom of Bhutan is a landlocked country in South Asia, located at the eastern end of the Himalayas and bordered by India to the south, east and west; China to the north.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Bolivian Boliviano/US$. During this period it adopted several exchange regimes: fixed, managed and independent floating rate systems. Some years, it has had separate exchange rate systems as well. In addition, On January 1987, the peso was replaced at the rate of 1 boliviano = 1000,000 peso.
GENERAL_NOTES: Bolivia is a landlocked country in central South America and borders Brazil to the North and East, Paraguay and Argentina to the South, and Chile and Peru to the West.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Convertible Marks/ US$. In 1998, the convertible mark(BAM) has been introduced to replace Bosnia and Herzegovina dinar to pegged to Mark at par. Since 2002, as the German mark was replaced by the euro, the Bosnian convertible mark has been fixed at exchange rate of 1 EUR = 1.95583 BAM.
GENERAL_NOTES: Bosnia and Herzegovina is in Southeastern Europe Bordering Croatia on the north, west and south; Serbia on the east, and Montenegro on the southeast, It has a narrow strip of coastline on the Adriatic Sea. It claimed independence in 1992 after the dissolution of the Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia. The country then fought the Bosnian War until late 1995. It is a member of NATO, the Council of Europe and the Mediterranean Union.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Pula/US$. In 1976, the pula was introduced replacing the South African Rand at par. Though in 1970s the rate was pegged either to US$ or to South African Rand, the official rate has been pegged to a basket of currencies for the rest of the period. Currently a crawling peg system is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Botswana is a landlocked country in Southern Africa. It is bordered by South Africa to the south and southeast, Namibia to the west and north, Zambia to the north and Zimbabwe to the northeast. It is a member of the Southern African Customs Union (SACU), in which tariffs have been eliminated on the trade of goods between other member countries Lesotho, Namibia, South Africa, and Swaziland.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Brazil Real/ US$. Brazil has a history of turbulent currency re-establishments and usage of different exchange rate systems.
GENERAL_NOTES: Brazil is in South America and the only Portuguese-speaking country in the Americas. It is bordered by the Atlantic Ocean on the east; Venezuela, Guyana, Suriname French Guiana on the north; Colombia on the northwest; Bolivia and Peru on the west; Argentina and Paraguay on the southwest and Uruguay on the south. Brazil is a founding member of G20 and the Union of South American Nations.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Brunei Dollar/US$. This is pegged to Singapore dollar at per. The Brunei dollar was introduced in 1967 to replace the Malaya and British Borneo dollar. Until 1973, the Malaysian ringgit was exchangeable at par with the Singapore dollar and Brunei dollar. The Singapore dollar is also accepted in Brunei. Although the value of the Brunei dollar is the same as the Singapore dollar, in practice the exchange rate is lower in Canadian, U.S., and Belgium markets.
GENERAL_NOTES: Brunei is located on the north part of Borneo Island in the Southeast Asia. It has a coastline bordered by the South China Sea. Other part is completely surrounded by the state of Sarawak, Malaysia, and it is separated into two parts by Sarawak.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Bulgarian Lev/ US$. On July 1999 the lev was revalued at 1000:1 and 1 new lev equals to 1 Deutsche Mark. With the replacement of the Deutsche Mark by the euro, the lev's peg switched to the euro, at the rate of 1.95583 leva = 1 euro, the rate of conversion of the Deutsche Mark to euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: Bulgaria is a transition economy in south-eastern Europe. Bulgaria borders Romania to the north; Serbia and the Republic of Macedonia to the west; and Greece and Turkey to the south. The east of the country is bordered by Black Sea. It is a member of the European Union and G-20.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Western African CFA franc/US. The West African CFA franc is the currency of eight countries in West Africa: Benin, Burkina Faso, C??te d'Ivoire, Guinea-Bissau, Mali, Niger, S??n??gal and Togo. In several central African states, the Central African CFA franc, which is of equal value to the West African CFA franc, is in circulation. They are both the CFA franc. Before 1999, this was pegged to the French Franc. In 1994, this is devalued 100 CFA franc= French franc. From 1999, it has been pegged to the Euro (655.957 CFA Franc= 1 Euro).
GENERAL_NOTES: Burkina Faso is a landlocked country in West Africa. It is bordered by six countries: Mali to the north, Niger to the east, Benin to the southeast, Togo and Ghana to the south, and C??te d'Ivoire to the southwest. It is a member of the African Union, Organization of the Islamic Conference and Economic Community of West African States.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Burundi Franc/US$.
GENERAL_NOTES: Burundi is a landlocked country in the Great Lakes region of Eastern Africa bordered by Rwanda to the north, Tanzania to the east and south, and the Democratic Republic of the Congo to the west. Although the country is landlocked, much of the south-western border is adjacent to Lake Tanganyika. Burundi has been facing a long standing ethnic and political unrest and civil wars mainly due to social differences between the Tutsi and Hutu tribes.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Riel/US $. The first riel was active between 1953 and May 1975. From 1975 to 1980, during Khmer Rouge rule, the country had no monetary system. A second riel has been issued in 1980. However, the US dollar has also been a widely accepted currency.
GENERAL_NOTES: Cambodia is located in the southern portion of the Indochina Peninsula in Southeast Asia bordered by Thailand to the northwest, Laos to the northeast, Vietnam to the east and the Gulf of Thailand to the southwest.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in CFA franc/US$. Until 1999, the official rate was pegged to the French franc. In 1994, CFA franc was devalued (100 CFC franc = Franc franc). Since January 1999, CFC franc is pegged to the Euro at the rate of 655.957 per Euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: Cameroon is a country of central and western Africa. It is bordered by Nigeria to the west; Chad to the northeast; the Central African Republic to the east; and Equatorial Guinea, Gabon, and the Republic of the Congo to the south. Its coastline lies on the Bight of Bonny, part of the Gulf of Guinea and the Atlantic Ocean.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Canadian Dollar/ US$. Since 1971 the country has adopted a floating exchange rate regime. The rate is determined by the midpoint rate quoted by the Bank of Canada at noon in the Montreal-Toronto inter-bank exchange market.
GENERAL_NOTES: Canada occupies most of northern North America, extending from the Atlantic Ocean in the east to the Pacific Ocean in the west and northward into the Arctic Ocean. Canada boarders the United States to the south and the northwest. Canada is a federation and a bilingual nation with both English and French as official languages at the federal level. It has a diversified economy that is reliant upon its abundant natural resources. Its major trading partner is the United States. It is a member of G8, G-20, OECD and APEC.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in CFA franc/US$. Until 1999, the official rate was pegged to the French franc. In 1994, CFA franc was devalued (100 CFC franc = Franc franc). Since January 1999, CFC franc is pegged to the Euro at the rate of 655.957 per Euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: The Central African Republic is a landlocked country in Central Africa. It borders Chad to the north, Sudan to the east, the Democratic Republic of the Congo and the Republic of the Congo to the south, and Cameroon to the west.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in CFA franc/US$. Until 1999, the official rate was pegged to the French franc. In 1994, CFA franc was devalued (100 CFC franc = Franc franc). Since January 1999, CFC franc is pegged to the Euro at the rate of 655.957 per Euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: Chad is a landlocked country in central Africa. It is bordered by Libya to the north, Sudan to the east, the Central African Republic to the south, Cameroon and Nigeria to the southwest, and Niger to the west.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Chilean Peso/ US$. Current Peso was introduced in September 1975 replacing the escudo at a rate of 1 peso for 1,000 escudos. In many years in 1970s, the rate was pegged to the US$. From 1985-1999, the exchange regime was based on a system of floating bands and the reference margins were adjusted several times. On September, 1999, the peso has been allowed to float freely. In many years it operated separate exchange rates.
GENERAL_NOTES: Chile is in South America. It borders Pacific Ocean to the west, Peru to the north, Bolivia to the northeast, Argentina to the east, and the Drake Passage in the far south. In 2010 Chile became the first South American country to join the OECD. Chile is also a founding member of the Union of South American Nations. It is a member of APEC.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Chinese Yuan/ US$. For most of its early history, this was pegged to the US$ at 2.46 yuan per US$. However, during the 1970s, it was appreciated until it reached 1.50 yuan per US$ in 1980. When China's economy gradually opened in the 1980s, it was devalued in order to improve the competitiveness of exports. It adopts a crawl-like arrangement.
GENERAL_NOTES: China is in East Asia bordered by Russia, North Korea and Mongolia on the north; East China Sea, Korea Bay, Yellow Sea on the east; Pakistan on the west; India, Bhutan, Nepal on the south west; Laos, Vietnam, Burma on the south, and South China Sea on the south between North Korea and Vietnam. China is a member of the APEC, Shanghai Cooperation Organization, the East Asia Summit and G-20.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Colombia Peso/ US$. From 1967 and up until 1991, the exchange rate regime in Colombia was defined by a crawling peg. The Colombian peso was pegged to the U.S. dollar at a pre-specified exchange rate and was not allowed to depart significantly from this rate. On September 1999, the peso was allowed to float independently; however the authorities intervene when necessary.
GENERAL_NOTES: Colombia is a constitutional republic in north-western South America. Colombia borders Venezuela and Brazil to the east; Ecuador and Peru to the south; Panama and the Caribbean Sea to the north; and Ecuador and the Pacific Ocean to the west. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Comorian franc/ US$. Before July 1973, Comoros and Madagascar adopted a fixed exchange rate system (50 Madagascar-Comoros CFA francs = 1 French franc). On November 1979, the government introduced a fixed parity system between the French franc and the Comorian franc. With the introduction of the euro in 1999, the Comorian franc has been pegged to the Euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: The Comoros is an archipelago in the Indian Ocean, located near the eastern coast of Africa, between north-eastern Mozambique and north-western Madagascar. Other closest countries are Tanzania to the northwest and the Seychelles to the northeast. Since it independence in 1975, it has faced several coups.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Congo franc /US$. On July 1998, the Congo Franc (equal to 100,000 new Zaire) was introduced. Some years it adopted several exchange rates for transactions; therefore, we use AMA exchange rate to avoid price differences.
GENERAL_NOTES: The Democratic Republic of the Congo formerly known as Zaire (1971-1997) is located in Central Africa, with a Atlantic coastline. It borders the Central African Republic and Sudan to the north; Uganda, Rwanda, and Burundi to the east; Zambia and Angola to the south; the Republic of the Congo to the west; and is separated from Tanzania by Lake Tanganyika in the east. The Second Congo War, beginning in 1998, devastated the country, involved seven foreign armies. The war is the world's deadliest conflict since World War II, killing 5.4 million people.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in CFA franc/US$. Until 1999, the official rate was pegged to the French franc. In 1994, the CFA franc was devalued (100 CFC franc = Franc franc). Since January 1999, the CFC franc is pegged to the Euro at the rate of 655.957 per Euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: The Republic of the Congo is in Central Africa. It is bordered by Gabon, Cameroon, the Central African Republic, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, and the Gulf of Guinea.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Costa Rican Colon /US$. A managed floating regime is adopted. In some years it used separate exchange rates for different transactions.
GENERAL_NOTES: Costa Rica which is a Latin American country in Central America, bordered by Nicaragua to the north, Panama to the east and south, the Pacific Ocean to the west and south and the Caribbean Sea to the east. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in CFA franc/US$. Until 1999, the official rate was pegged to the French franc. In 1994, the CFA franc was devalued (100 CFC franc = Franc franc). Since January 1999, the CFC franc is pegged to the Euro at the rate of 655.957 per Euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: C??te d'Ivoire, known as Ivory Coast is in West Africa. It borders Liberia, Guinea, Mali, Burkina Faso and Ghana; its southern boundary is on the Gulf of Guinea.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Croatian Kuna/ US$. In 1991, the Croatian dinar replaced Yugoslav dinar at par. The dinar was the currency of Croatia between December 23, 1991, and May 1994. The dinar was replaced by the kuna at a rate of 1 kuna = 1000 dinar.
GENERAL_NOTES: Croatia is in South-eastern Europe bordering the Adriatic Sea, between Bosnia and Herzegovina and Slovenia. After declaration of independence in 1991, Croatia fought the War of Independence from 1991 to 1995. Croatia is a member of the United Nations, the Council of Europe, NATO, the World Trade Organization, CEFTA and a founding member of the Union for the Mediterranean.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Euro / US$. The Cyprus pound (CYP), also known as the lira was the currency of Cyprus until 31 December 2007, when Cyprus adopted the euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: Cyprus is an Island in the Mediterranean sea, located south of Turkey and west of Syria and Lebanon. It joined the European Union on May 2004 and therefore a member of G-20.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Czech Koruna/ US$. The Czech koruna (Czech crown ) is introduced on February 1993 to replace the Czechoslovak koruna at par.
GENERAL_NOTES: After dissolving Czechoslovakia into two states in 1993, the Czech Republic and Slovak Republic were formed. The Czech Republic is a landlocked country in Central Europe bordered by Germany to the west, Austria to the south, Slovakia to the east and Poland to the north. It is a member of the European Union, NATO, the OECD, the OSCE, the Council of Europe and the Visegr??d Group.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Danish Krone/US$ which is determined by the midpoint rate in the Copenhagen market.
GENERAL_NOTES: Denmark is a Scandinavian country in Northern Europe. It is the Southernmost of the Nordic countries, southwest of Sweden and south of Norway, and bordered to the south by Germany. Denmark borders both the Baltic and the North Sea. Denmark is a constitutional monarchy with a parliamentary system of government. It has been a member of the European Union since 1973, although it has not joined the Euro zone. Denmark is a founding member of OECD. Denmark is also a member of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE). It signed the Schengen agreement in 2001. It is a member of G-20 as well.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Djibouti franc/ US$. Since 1974, This has been pegged to US$ ( 177.721 franc/ US$)
GENERAL_NOTES: Djibouti is in the Horn of Africa bordered by Eritrea to the north, Ethiopia to the west and to the south, and Somalia to the southeast. It has a maritime border formed by the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden at the east.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in East Caribbean Dollar(EC) / US$. Since 1976, this has been pegged to the United States: US$1 = EC$2.70.
GENERAL_NOTES: Dominica is in the Caribbean Sea between Puerto Rico and Trinidad and Tobago. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Dominican Republic Peso Oro/ US$. Until the 1980s the peso was worth the same as the USD. Currently a Crawl-like arrangement is adopted. The United States dollar is used as a reserve currency by the Dominican Central Bank. Both U.S. dollars and Euro are used in private transactions especially during the high inflationary period 2003-2004.
GENERAL_NOTES: The Dominican Republic is in the Caribbean region. It is bordered by Haiti on the east. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in US$. To avoid devaluation of the currency, in 2000, the government adopts the U.S. dollar as the official currency of Ecuador to address the ongoing economic crisis.
GENERAL_NOTES: Ecuador is in South America, bordered by Colombia on the north, Peru on the east and south, and by the Pacific Ocean to the west. Ecuador is a member of OPEC; however, it suspended its membership from December 1992-October 2007. Deteriorating economic performance in 1997-98 resulted in a severe economic and financial crisis in 1999.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Egyptian Pound/ US$. The Egyptian pound was devalued in 1978 to peg 1 Egyptian pound = 1.42857 dollars. It has been allowed to float since1989; however, the float is tightly managed by the authorities. By 2005, the exchange rate system is unified; however, multiple exchange rate existed in many years during this period. currently a stabilized arrangement is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Egypt is in the North Africa bordered by the Mediterranean Sea to the north, the Gaza Strip and Israel to the northeast, the Red Sea to the east, Sudan to the south and Libya to the west.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in US$/US$. On June 1990 the exchange system was unified. The exchange rate is determined by commercial banks and exchange houses which are authorized to operate in the foreign exchange market. Since January 1993, the central bank has intervened in the market to maintain the value at 8.755 Colon per U.S. dollar. From January 2001, the U.S. dollar has been used as the legal tender.
GENERAL_NOTES: El Salvador is in Central America. It borders the Pacific Ocean between Guatemala and Honduras.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in CFA franc/US$. Until 1999, the official rate was pegged to the French franc. In 1994, CFA franc was devalued (100 CFC franc = Franc franc). Since January 1999, CFC franc is pegged to the Euro at the rate of 655.957 per Euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: Equatorial Guinea is in Middle Africa. It has two parts, an insular and a mainland region. The insular region consists of the islands of Bioko in the Gulf of Guinea and Annob??n. S??o Tom?? and Pr??ncipe is between Bioko and Annob??n. The mainland region is bordered by Cameroon on the north and Gabon on the south and east. It includes several small offshore islands as well. It is one of the largest oil producers in sub Sahara.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Euro/ US$. On June 1992, the kroon was reintroduced replacing the Soviet ruble at the rate of 1 kroon = 10 rubles. Initially, the Estonian kroon was pegged to the Deutsche Mark at a rate of 8 krooni = 1 Deutsche Mark. After the introduction of the euro, it fixed at the rate of 15.64664 krooni to the euro. On June 2004, the Estonian kroon was revalued at the rate of 15.6466 krooni per euro. Euro was introduced in 2011.
GENERAL_NOTES: Estonia, a former state of Soviet Union, is in Northern Europe bordered by Finland to the north, Baltic Sea to the west, Lativia to the south, and Lake Peipus and Russia to the east. Across the Baltic Sea lies Sweden in the west and Finland in the north. It is member of the European Union, Eurozone and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Birr/US$. Until 1993, this was pegged to US$. From 1993-1995, a dual exchange system was adopted (as official and auction rates). In July 1995, a unified system was introduced. By 2012, this has a Crawl-like arrangement.
GENERAL_NOTES: Ethiopia is a landlocked country located in the Horn of Africa. It is bordered by Eritrea to the north, Sudan to the west, Djibouti and Somalia to the east, and Kenya to the south.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Fiji Dollar/US$. The official rate is fixed to a weighted basket of currencies.
GENERAL_NOTES: Fiji is an island nation in Melanesia in the South Pacific Ocean. Its neighbours are Vanuatu to the west, France's New Caledonia to the southwest, New Zealand's Kermadec to the southeast, Tonga to the east, the Samoa's and France's Wallis and Futuna to the northeast and Tuvalu to the north.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed Euro/US$. In 1999, the markka became a participatory currency within Euro system and the EURO market rate is applicable to all transactions at the rate of 1 Euro = 5.94573. From 2002, the markka was retired from circulation.
GENERAL_NOTES: Finland is a Nordic country situated in Northern Europe. It borders Sweden to the west, Norway to the north and Russia to the east, while Estonia boarders its south across the Gulf of Finland. Finland was historically a part of Sweden and from 1809 -1917 a part of the Russian Empire. Finland is member of OECD, the European Union and G20.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Euro/US$. In January 1999, the French franc became a participatory currency within euro system, the euro market rate became applicable to all transactions. French franc was replaced by the Euro at the rate of 1 Euro = 6.55957 French Franc.
GENERAL_NOTES: France is in Western Europe and some of its overseas territories and islands are located on other continents and in the Indian, Pacific, and Atlantic oceans. Metropolitan France extends from the Mediterranean Sea to the English Channel and the North Sea, and from the Rhine to the Atlantic Ocean. It borders Belgium, Luxembourg, Germany, Switzerland, Italy, Monaco, Spain and Andorra. France's overseas departments and collectivities also share land borders with Brazil and Suriname (bordering French Guiana), and the Netherlands Antilles (bordering Saint-Martin). France is linked to the United Kingdom by the Channel Tunnel. France is a founding member of the European Union and a member of G8, G20 and OECD. It signed the Schengen agreement in 1985.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in CFA franc/US$. Until 1999, the official rate was pegged to the French franc. In 1994, the CFA franc was devalued (100 CFC franc = Franc franc). Since January 1999, the CFC franc is pegged to the Euro at the rate of 655.957 per Euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: Gabon is in west central Africa sharing borders with the Gulf of Guinea to the west, Equatorial Guinea to the northwest, and Cameroon to the north, with the Republic of the Congo to the east and south. It had a membership of OPEC until 1995.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Gambian Dalasi/US$. The Dalasi was adopted in 1971 which replaced the Gambian pound at the rate 1 pound = 5 dalasi. Though by 2012 a managed float system is adopted, many years the rate has been pegged to the Pound.
GENERAL_NOTES: The Gambia is a in West Africa bordered to the north, east, and south by Senegal, with a small coast on the Atlantic Ocean in the west.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Lari/ US$. On April 1993, the Russian ruble was replaced by kupon lari at par. On October 1995, the government replaced the provisional coupon currency with the lari, at a rate of one million to one.
GENERAL_NOTES: Georgia is in the Caucasus region of Eurasia located at the crossroads of Western Asia and Eastern Europe. , It is border by Black sea to the west , Russia to the north; Turkey and Armenia to the south; and Azerbaijan to the southeast. After it received independence in 1991, Georgia suffered from civil unrest and economic crisis for most of the 1990s until the Rose Revolution of 2003. It is a member of the Council of Europe and the Organization for Democracy and Economic Development (GUAM).

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Euro/US$. From July 1990, the Deutsche Mark became the sole currency of Germany, when the custom borders between former Federal Republic of Germany and the former German Democratic Republic were abolished. In 1999, the Deutsche Mark became a participatory currency within Euro system and the EURO market rate is applicable to all transactions at the rate of 1 Euro = 1.95583 Deutsche Mark. From 2002, the Euro has become the official currency.
GENERAL_NOTES: Germany in Central Europe. It is bordered to the north by the North Sea, Denmark, and the Baltic Sea; to the east by Poland and the Czech Republic; to the south by Austria and Switzerland; and to the west by France, Luxembourg, Belgium, and the Netherlands. Germany which was separated as East and West after the World War II was reunified in 1990. West Germany was a founding member of the European Community (EC) in 1957, which became the European Union in 1993. Germany is a federal parliamentary republic of sixteen states. Germany is a member of G8, G20 and OECD. It signed Schengen agreement in 1985.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Ghanaian cedi/US$. In early 1970s the rate was pegged to the US$. However by 2012, a float system is adopted.
GENERAL_NOTES: Ghana is in West Africa. It is bordered by C??te d'Ivoire (Ivory Coast) to the west, Burkina Faso to the north, Togo to the east, and the Gulf of Guinea to the south.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed Euro/US$. In 1999, the drachma became a participatory currency within Euro system and the EURO market rate is applicable to all transactions at the rate of 1 Euro=340.750 drachma. From 2002, the drachma was retired from circulation.
GENERAL_NOTES: Greece is in the south-eastern Europe, situated on the southern end of the Balkan Peninsula. The country borders Albania, the Republic of Macedonia and Bulgaria to the north, and Turkey to the east. The Aegean Sea lies to the east of mainland Greece, the Ionian Sea to the west, and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. Greece is member of the European Union (since 1981), OECD, G20 and the Schengen agreement. It is also a founding member of the OECD, and the Black Sea Economic Cooperation Organization.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in East Caribbean Dollar/ US$. Since 1976, this has been pegged to the United States: US$1 = EC$2.70.
GENERAL_NOTES: Grenada is an island country located northwest of Trinidad and Tobago, northeast of Venezuela, and southwest of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Guatemala Quetzal/ US$. Until 1987, the quetzal was pegged to the United States dollar. Before pegging to the US dollar, it was pegged to the French franc as well. In 1987, a floating system was introduced. However, from April 30, 2004, the authorities have introduced a managed floating system. A multiple exchange rate system, introduced on November 1984 and modified on June 1986, was abandoned in 1991.
GENERAL_NOTES: Guatemala is in Central America bordered by Mexico to the north and west, the Pacific Ocean to the southwest, Belize to the northeast, the Caribbean to the east, and Honduras and El Salvador to the southeast. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Guinean franc/US$. The Guinean franc was reintroduced as Guinea's currency in 1985, at par with the syli which replaced franc at a rate of 1 syli = 10 francs in 1971. On March 2005, the a managed floating system with no predetermined path for the exchange rate has been introduced by replacing a conventional pegged arrangement. A significant number of transactions take place on the parallel market at a large margin from the official rate. Therefore we use AMA exchange rates from UNDATAbase. This includes IMF-based rates and PAREs (Price adjusted rates of exchange) which are calculated by UNSD. PAREs are applied when there is a serious disparity between real GDP growth and growth when GDP was converted to United states dollars using IMF-based rates.
GENERAL_NOTES: Guinea which is formerly known as French Guinea is in West Africa. It borders Atlantic Ocean to its west. Its northern border is shared with Guinea-Bissau, Senegal, and Mali, the southern border with Sierra Leone, Liberia, and C??te d'Ivoire.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in CFA franc/US$. Until 1999, the official rate was pegged to the French franc. In 1994, the CFA franc was devalued (100 CFC franc = Franc franc). Since January 1999, the CFC franc has been pegged to the Euro at the rate of 655.957 per Euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: Guinea-Bissau is located in West Africa bordered by Senegal to the north, and Guinea to the south and east, with the Atlantic Ocean to its west. Before 1997, the country faced economic down turn and political instability. The civil war that took place in 1998 and 1999 and a military coup in September 2003 disrupted again economic activity, leaving a substantial part of the economic and social infrastructure in ruins.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Guyanese Dollar/US$. From 1984 to February 1991, this was pegged to a basket of currencies. Now a stabilized arrangement is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Guyana is on the northern coast of South America and bordered to the east by Suriname, to the south and southwest by Brazil, to the west by Venezuela, and on the north by the Atlantic Ocean. It is a member of the Caribbean Community (CARICOM).

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Haitian Gourde/ US$. In 1912, the gourde was pegged to the US dollar at a value of 5 gourdes to the US dollar. This was abandoned in 1989. Since 1995, the Bank has operated a dollar clearing house. Currently, the country adopts a Crawl-like exchange rate arrangement.
GENERAL_NOTES: Haiti is a Caribbean country. Along with the Dominican Republic, it occupies the island of Hispaniola, in the Greater Antillean archipelago. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed Honduras Lempira/ US$. Since July 1994, the exchange rate has been determined through daily auctions by the Central Bank. From February 1992 to June 30 1992, a dual system was adopted: the principal rate referred to the interbank rate which was the average exchange rate in the exchange house market in the preceding week, and the secondary rate was a market exchange rate determined by the foreign exchange houses. Currently, the country adopts a Crawl-like exchange rate arrangement.
GENERAL_NOTES: Honduras is in Central America bordered by Guatemala to the west, El Salvador to the southwest, Nicaragua to the southeast, the Pacific Ocean to the south and the Gulf of Honduras to the north. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Hong Kong Dollar/ US $. It adopts a currency board arrangement and the rate is pegged to United States dollar = HK$7.75?€?7.85.
GENERAL_NOTES: Hong Kong is one of the two special administrative regions of the People's Republic of China. It is situated in China's south coast and enclosed by the Pearl River Delta and South China Sea. The British controlled the country until 1997, when China regained sovereignty. However, Hong Kong enjoys relatively  in all matters except foreign relations and military defence.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Hungary Forint /US$. The country adopts a floating exchange rate system.
GENERAL_NOTES: Hungary is a landlocked country in Central Europe, bordered by Austria, Slovakia, Ukraine, Romania, Serbia, Croatia, and Slovenia. It is a member of the European Union, G-20 and OECD.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Iceland Krona/US$. In 1981, the Icelandic kr??na was revalued, with 100 old kr??nur = 1 new kr??na.
GENERAL_NOTES: Iceland is a European island country located in the North Atlantic Ocean on the Mid-Atlantic Ridge. It is a member of OECD.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Indian Rupee/US$. Currently. A floating system is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: India is in South Asia. India is bounded by the Indian Ocean on the south, the Arabian Sea on the west, and the Bay of Bengal on the east; and it is bordered by Pakistan to the west; China, Nepal, and Bhutan to the north; and Bangladesh and Burma to the east. It is a member of G20 and the East Asia summit.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Indonesian Rupiah/ US$. A floating system is in effect. Indonesia was the country hardest hit by the East Asian financial crisis of 1997-98. Against the US dollar, the value of rupiah dropped sharply.
GENERAL_NOTES: Indonesia, officially the Republic of Indonesia is in the Southeast Asia and Oceania. Indonesia comprises 17,508 islands. The country shares land borders with Papua New Guinea, East Timor, and Malaysia. Other neighbouring countries include Singapore, Philippines, Australia, and the Indian territory of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. Indonesia is a founding member of the ASEAN, APEC, East Asia summit and a member of G-20. It suspended membership of OPEC in 2009.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Iranian Rial / US$. In 1975, the peg to the U.S. dollar was dropped. In 1979, after the Islamic revolution, the value of Iran's currency declined due to capital flight from the country. However, since 1999, the value of the rial has become more stable as the economy of Iran has been growing rapidly. Before march 2002, Iran's exchange rate system was based on a multi-layered system. State and para-state enterprises benefited from the preferred rate (1750 rial for $1) while the private sector had the market rate (8000 rial for $1), This had created an unequal competition environment. In March 2002, a unified system ( managed float) was introduced. We use AMA exchange rates from UNDATAbase. This includes IMF-based rates and PAREs (Price adjusted rates of exchange) which are calculated by UNSD. PAREs are applied when there is a serious disparity between real GDP growth and growth when GDP was converted to United states dollars using IMF-based rates.
GENERAL_NOTES: Iran in Asia and bordered on the north by Armenia, Azerbaijan and Turkmenistan: on the east by Afghanistan and Pakistan, on the south by the Persian Gulf and the Gulf of Oman, on the west by Iraq and on the northwest by Turkey. It is a founding member of OPEC.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Iraqi dinar/ US$. We use AMA exchange rates from UNDATAbase. This includes IMF-based rates and PAREs (Price adjusted rates of exchange) which are calculated by UNSD. PAREs are applied when there is a serious disparity between real GDP growth and growth when GDP was converted to United states dollars using IMF-based rates.
GENERAL_NOTES: Iraq is in Western Asia bordered by Syria to the northwest, Turkey to the north, Iran to the east, Jordan to the west, Saudi Arabia to the south and southwest, and Kuwait to the south. Its coastline is on the northern Persian Gulf. Iraq was governed by the Ba'ath Party until American and British forces invaded in 2003 . The American occupation of Iraq ended in 2011

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed Euro/US$. In 1999, the Irish pound became a participatory currency within Euro system and the EURO market rate is applicable to all transactions at the rate of 1 Euro=0.787564 Pound. From 2002, the Irish pound was retired from circulation.
GENERAL_NOTES: Ireland is the third largest island in Europe. It lies to the northwest of continental Europe and is surrounded by hundreds of islands and islets. the east of Ireland is Great Britain, separated from it by the Irish Sea. It is a member of the European union, G20 and OECD.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in New Shekel/ US$. The new shekel replaced the old shekel on January 1, 1986 at a rate of 1,000 old shekel = 1 new shekel. Since January 1, 2003, the shekel has been a freely convertible currency. However since January 2004, the exchange regime has been changed from crawling pegged band system to independently floating. Before 2004, the exchange rate of the new sheqel was managed against a basket of currencies comprising the dollar, the euro, the pound sterling, and the yen and the rate fluctuated within a crawling band in response to market forces.
GENERAL_NOTES: Israel is in Western Asia located on the eastern shore of the Mediterranean Sea. It borders Lebanon in the north, Syria in the northeast, Jordan and the West Bank in the east, the Gaza Strip and Egypt on the southwest. It is a member of the OECD (2010).

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Euro/US$. In January 1999, the lira became a participatory currency within euro system, the euro market rate became applicable to all transactions. The lira was replaced by Euro at the rate of 1 Euro = 1,936.27 lira. In 2002, the lira was retired from calculations.
GENERAL_NOTES: Italy is on the European Continent and partly on the Italian Peninsula in Southern Europe, Its two largest islands, Sicily and Sardinia are in the Mediterranean Sea. Italy shares its borders with France, Switzerland, Austria and Slovenia from the north. It is a peninsula extending into the central Mediterranean Sea northeast of Tunisia. It is a member of G8, G20, the European Union, OECD and a member of the Schengen agreement from 1997.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Jamaican Dollar/US$. The country adopts a Crawl_like arrangement.
GENERAL_NOTES: Jamaica is in the Caribbean Sea, south of Cuba, and west of Haiti and the Dominican Republic. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Japanese yen / US$. The fixed exchange rate at ??360 per US$1 was maintained until 1971, when the United States abandoned the gold standard. By 1971 the yen had become undervalued. In the summer of 1971, the Japanese government fixed exchange rate and set the exchange rate at ??308 per US$1. In early 1973, the currency is allowed to float freely.
GENERAL_NOTES: Japan is an island country in East Asia and located in the Pacific Ocean. It lies to the east of the Sea of Japan, China, North Korea, South Korea and Russia, stretching from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and Taiwan in the south. Since 1947, Japan has maintained a unitary constitutional monarchy with an emperor and an elected parliament. Japan is a member of G8, G20, APEC, OECD and East Asia summit.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Jordan Dinar/ US$. The country uses a conventional pegged arrangement. Since October 23, 1995, the dinar has been officially pegged to the IMF's Special Drawing Rights (SDR). Since late 1995, it has been pegged to US$.
GENERAL_NOTES: It borders Saudi Arabia to the southeast, Iraq to the east, Syria to the north, Palestine and Israel to the west, sharing control of the Dead Sea. Since King Abdullah II's accession to the throne in 1999, liberal economic policies have been introduced which has resulted in a boom lasting for a decade continuing even through 2009.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Tenge/ US$. On November 1993, the tenge replaced the Soviet ruble at a rate of 1 tenge = 500 rubles.
GENERAL_NOTES: Kazakhstan, the world's largest landlocked country is in Central Asia, with a small portion west of the Ural River in easternmost Europe. It borders the north by Russia, China, Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan, and Turkmenistan, and the Caspian Sea. It is a member of the United Nations, the Euro-Atlantic Partnership Council, the Commonwealth of Independent States, and the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Kenyan Shilling /US$. A floating exchange rate system is in effect. In early year it was either pegged to the SDR or to a weighted basket of currencies.
GENERAL_NOTES: Kenya is in East Africa bordered by Ethiopia (north), Somalia (northeast), Tanzania (south), Uganda plus Lake Victoria (west), and Sudan (northwest). In 1996, Kenya, Tanzania, and Uganda re-established the East African Community (EAC). The EAC's objectives include harmonizing tariffs and customs regimes, free movement of people, and improving regional infrastructures. In 2004, the three East African countries signed a Customs Union Agreement.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Australian dollar/ US$. Kiribati dollar is not an independent currency and pegged at 1:1 ratio to the Australian dollar. There is no central monetary institution and authorities do not buy and sell foreign exchange.
GENERAL_NOTES: Kiribati is an island nation located in the central tropical Pacific Ocean. It consists of 32 atolls and one raised coral island, spread over 3.5 million square kilometres. It is bordered by the International Date Line to the east. Kiribati became independent from the United Kingdom in 1979.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in South Korean Won/ US$. The Won was pegged with the US$ until 1980. Now it adopts a market determined system but authorities intervene when necessary.
GENERAL_NOTES: South Korea is in East Asia, located on the southern portion of the Korean Peninsula. It is neighboured by China to the west, Japan to the east, and North Korea to the north. South Korea is a member of the OECD and G-20 major economies. It is also a founding member of APEC and the East Asia Summit.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Kuwait Dinar/US$. A conventional pegged arrangement is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: It borders Saudi Arabia to the south and Iraq to the north and lies on the north-western shore of the Persian Gulf. Kuwait is one of the fastest growing economies in the region. Kuwait is a member of OPEC and also a member of the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf, known as the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC).

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Som/ US$. On May 1993, the som was introduced replacing the Soviet ruble at a rate of 1 som = 200 rubles.
GENERAL_NOTES: Kyrgyzstan is a landlocked country in Central Asia. It borders Kazakhstan to the north, Uzbekistan to the west, Tajikistan to the southwest and China to the east. It received its independence in 1991 from the Soviet Union. Kyrgyzstan is a member of the Turkic Council and the T??RKSOY community, the Commonwealth of Independent States, the Eurasian Economic Community, the Non-aligned movement and the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Kip/US$. In December 1979, the old Pathet Lao kip was replaced by the new Lao kip at a rate of 100 to 1. A stabilized system is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Laos is a landlocked country in Southeast Asia, bordered by Burma and China to the northwest, Vietnam to the east, Cambodia to the south, and Thailand to the west. after the long standing civil war the Communist Pathet Lao movement came to power in 1975. It is a member of the Asia-Pacific Trade Agreement (APTA), Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), East Asia Summit and La Francophonie.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Latvian Lats/ US$. Latvia became independent in 1991.In May 1992, the Latvian rublis was introduced into circulation as a legal tender parallel to the existing ruble notes (1 Latvian rubli = 1 Russian ruble). The lats was introduced in 1993, replacing the rublis at the rate of 1 lats = 200 rubli. On January 2014, the country adopts Euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: Latvia is in the Baltic region of Northern Europe bordered by Estonia to the north; Lithuania to the south; Russia to the east; and Belarus to the southeast and it has a maritime border with Sweden to the west. Latvia is a member of the United Nations, European Union, Council of Europe, NATO, Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe, International Monetary Fund and World Trade Organization, and is part of the Schengen Area.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed Lebanese pound/ US$. Since December 1997, the rate has been fixed at 1507.5 pounds per US$. A stabilized arrangement is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Lebanon is on the eastern shore of the Mediterranean Sea and bordered by Syria to the north and east, and Israel to the south. In 1975, civil war broke out in Lebanon. The Lebanese Civil War which is started in 1975 lasted fifteen years, devastating the country's economy, and resulting in massive loss of human life and property.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Lesotho Loti/ US$ which is pegged to South African rand at par. The official currency is the loti, but can be used interchangeably with the South African rand. Lesotho, Swaziland and South Africa also form a common currency and exchange control area known as the Common Monetary Area (CMA).
GENERAL_NOTES: Lesotho is a landlocked country and enclave-entirely surrounded by the Republic of South Africa. Lesotho is a member of the Southern African Customs Union (SACU), in which tariffs have been eliminated on the trade of goods between other member countries Botswana, Namibia, South Africa, and Swaziland.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in US$. From 1943- 1982, Liberia used the US dollar as its currency and it continues to use the U.S. dollar as an alternative currency to the Liberian dollar. Therefore, we express exchange rate in US$.
GENERAL_NOTES: Liberia is in West Africa bordered by Sierra Leone to the west, Guinea to the north and C??te d'Ivoire to the east. A military coup which overthrew the America-Liberian leadership in 1980 created political and economic instability and led two successive civil wars. It signed a peace agreement in 2003 and had democratic elections in 2005.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Libyan Dinar/US$ which has been pegged to a composite currency basket.
GENERAL_NOTES: Libya is located in North Africa. Bordering the Mediterranean Sea to the north, Libya lies between Egypt to the east, Sudan to the southeast, Chad and Niger to the south, and Algeria and Tunisia to the west. It is a member of the OPEC.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Lithuanian Litas / US$. The Lithuanian litas was introduced in 1993. From 1994 to 2002, the litas was pegged to the U.S. dollar at the rate of 4 to 1. Currently the litas is pegged to the euro at the rate of 3.4528 to 1.
GENERAL_NOTES: Lithuania is in Northern Europe located in the south-eastern shore of the Baltic Sea, to the east of Sweden and Denmark. It is bordered Latvia to the north, Belarus to the east and south, Poland to the south, and Kaliningrad Oblast (a Russian exclave) to the southwest. It became independent in 1991. It is a member of NATO, the Council of Europe, the European Union and the Schengen Agreement.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Euro/US$. Prior to March 1990, a dual exchange rate system was adopted. A cooperative exchange arrangement under the European Monetary system(EMS) was applicable to most transactions and the secondary or free market rate was applicable to most capital transactions. From march 1990 to December 1998, the market rate maintained within the EMS was applicable to all transactions. In January 1999, the Lux Franc became a participatory currency within euro system, the euro market rate became applicable to all transactions at the rate of 1 Euro = 40.3399 Lux Franc. In 2002, the Lux Franc was retired from circulations.
GENERAL_NOTES: Luxembourg is a landlocked country in western Europe, bordered by Belgium, France, and Germany. Luxembourg is a founding member of the European Union,G20 and OECD.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Macanese pataca/US$. This is pegged to Hong Kong dollar (1.032 Macanese pataca per Hong Kong Dollar)
GENERAL_NOTES: Macau is one of the two special administrative regions of China. It lies on the western side of the Pearl River Delta, bordered by Guangdong province to the north and South China Sea on the east and south. Its economy depends on gambling, tourism and manufacturing.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in denar/ US$. On April 1992, the first denar was introduced replacing 1990 version of the Yugoslav dinar at par. On 1993, the new denar has been introduced at the rate of new denar equals to 100 old denar.
GENERAL_NOTES: Macedonia is in Southeast Europe. It is a landlocked country Republic of Macedonia bordered by Kosovo to the northwest, Serbia to the north, Bulgaria to the east, Greece to the south and Albania to the west. Macedonia, a former state of the former Yugoslavia, declared independence in 1991. It is a member of the UN and the Council of Europe.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Madagascar Ariary/US$. The Ariary was introduced in January 2005 replacing the Malagasy franc at the rate of 1 Ariary= 5 Malagasy franc. A floating system is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Madagascar is an island nation in the Indian Ocean off the south-eastern coast of Africa.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Malawi Kwacha /US$.
GENERAL_NOTES: Malawi is a landlocked country in southeast Africa. It is bordered by Zambia to the northwest, Tanzania to the northeast, and Mozambique on the east, south and west. The country is separated from Tanzania and Mozambique by Lake Malawi.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Malaysian Ringgit/US$. Between 1995 and 1997, the ringgit was under a free float system and hanging around 2.50 to the U.S. dollar. Following the East Asian financial crisis, in September 1998, it was pegged the ringgit to the US dollar while remaining floated against other currencies. From July 2005, a managed float system is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Malaysia which is a constitutional monarchy in Southeast Asia consists of thirteen states and three federal territories. The country is separated by the South China Sea into two regions, Peninsular Malaysia and Malaysian Borneo (also known as East Malaysia). Malaysia borders Thailand, Indonesia, Singapore and Brunei. It is a member of the ASEAN, APEC and the South Asia Summit.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Pegged to Maldivian Rufiyaa/US$. From October 1994 the rate was pegged to the US$ ( 11.77 rufiyaa=US$). From July 2001, the rate was pegged to US$ at a rate of 12.80 Rufiyaa= 1 US$. On 10 April 2011, it was allowed to float within a band of 20% from the previous exchange rate. A stabilized system is in effect and Dual exchange rate system exists.
GENERAL_NOTES: The Maldives is an island nation in the Indian Ocean formed by a double chain of twenty-six atolls between Minicoy Island and Chagos Archipelago. It has around 1190 islets and lies in the Laccadive Sea, about seven hundred kilometres south-west of Sri Lanka.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in CFA franc/US$. Mali became a member of West African Monetary Union on June 1994. Until 1999, the official rate was pegged to the French franc. In 1994, the CFA franc was devalued (100 CFC franc = Franc franc). Since January 1999, the CFC franc has been pegged to the Euro at the rate of 655.957 per Euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: Mali is a landlocked country in Western Africa. Mali borders Algeria on the north, Niger on the east, Burkina Faso and the C??te d'Ivoire on the south, Guinea on the south-west, and Senegal and Mauritania on the west.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Euro/US$. The Euro replaced the Maltese lira on 1 January 2008 at the irrevocable fixed exchange rate of 0.4293 lira per 1 Euro. (The exchange rate before 2008 has been changed by conversion rate of 2.329373)
GENERAL_NOTES: Malta is a southern European country and consists of an archipelago situated centrally in the Mediterranean, south of Sicily and east of Tunisia, with the Strait of Gibraltar to the west and Alexandria to the east. It has been a member of European union since 2004 and member of Euro zone since 2008. It is also a member of G20.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Mauritanian Ouguiya/US$. The ouguiya was introduced in 1973, replacing the CFA franc at a rate of 1 ouguiya = 5 francs. A managed floating system with on pre-determined path is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Mauritania is located in North Africa. It is bordered by the Atlantic Ocean in the west, by Western Sahara in the north, by Algeria in the northeast, by Mali in the east and southeast, and by Senegal in the southwest.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Mauritius Rupee /US$. A floating system is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Mauritius is an island off the southeast coast of the African continent in the southwest Indian Ocean, about 900 kilometres east of Madagascar. It is a member of Commonwealth Nations.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Mexican New Peso/ US$. In the late 1980's, hyperinflation due to rapid government printing of paper money led to continual devaluations of the currency. Therefore in 1993, Nuevo Peso (New Peso) was introduced creating a parity of 1 New Peso for 1000 of the old ones. The exchange rate is allowed to float freely.
GENERAL_NOTES: Mexico is in North America bordered by the United States to the north; the Pacific Ocean to the south and west; Guatemala , Belize, and the Caribbean Sea to the southeast; and the Gulf of Mexico to the east. It is a member of G-20, APEC, OECD and CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Moldovan Leu/ US$. The Moldovan leu was introduced on November 1993, replacing the older cupon currency at a rate of 1 leu = 1000 cupon.
GENERAL_NOTES: Moldova is a landlocked country in Eastern Europe located between Romania to the west and Ukraine to the north, east, and south. It received its independence in 1991 from the former Soviet Union. It is a member state of the United Nations, Council of Europe, WTO, OSCE, GUAM, CIS, BSEC and other international organizations.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Mongolia Tugrik/US$. From May 1993, all rates were unified under the introduced floating rate system. However, currently a floating system is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Mongolia is a landlocked country in East and Central Asia. It borders Russia on the north and the China on the south, east and west. It is a transition economy.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Moroccan Dirham/ US$. A conventional pegged arrangement that sets on a basis of a weighted basket of currencies is adopted.
GENERAL_NOTES: Morocco is in North Africa. Western Sahara is also mainly under Moroccan administration. Morocco has a coast on the Atlantic Ocean and a water border with Spain to the north. Algeria lies to the east, and Mauritania is to the south.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Mozambican Metical/ US$. A floating system is in effect. On July 2006, the new metrical equal to 1000 metical was introduced.
GENERAL_NOTES: Mozambique is in south-eastern Africa bordered by the Indian Ocean to the east, Tanzania to the north, Malawi and Zambia to the northwest, Zimbabwe to the west and Swaziland and South Africa to the southwest. It is a member of Commonwealth Nations.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Kyat/US $. The military rule created economic disturbances. From 2001-2012, the official exchange rate varied between 5.75 and 6.70 kyats / US $ while black market rate ranged from 750 kyats to 1335 kyats/US$. Therefore, we use AMA exchange rates from UNDATAbase. This includes IMF-based rates and PAREs (Price adjusted rates of exchange) which are calculated by UNSD. PAREs are applied when there is a serious disparity between real GDP growth and growth when GDP was converted to United states dollars using IMF-based rates.
GENERAL_NOTES: Myanmar (Burma) is in Southeast Asia bordered by India, Bangladesh, China, Laos and Thailand. It has a coastline along the Bay of Bengal and the Andaman Sea. Since independence in 1948, the country has been in a civil war among ethnic groups. From 1962 to 2011, the country was under military rule. The Burmese economy is one of the least developed in the world.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Namibian Dollar/ US$. In 1993, the dollar replaced the South African rand. The south African rand is still legal tender and can be exchanged on a one-to-one basis. The Namibian dollar is pegged to the South African Rand at par.
GENERAL_NOTES: Namibia is in southern Africa bordered the Atlantic Ocean to the west. It shares land borders with Angola and Zambia to the north, Botswana and Zimbabwe to the east, and South Africa to the south and east. It gained independence from South Africa in 1990 after the Namibian War of Independence. It is a member of the Southern African Customs Union (SACU), in which tariffs have been eliminated on the trade of goods between other member countries Lesotho, Botswana, South Africa, and Swaziland. Lesotho, Swaziland, Namibia, and South Africa also form a common currency and exchange control area known as the Common Monetary Area (CMA).

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Nepalese Rupee/ US$. From February 1993, the rate was pegged to the Indian Rupee at 1.6 Nepalese Rupee/ US$ to introduced a unified system. However, Nepal has three main exchange rates: the government?€?s official rate, the private banks?€? rate and the black market rate agents).
GENERAL_NOTES: Nepal is a landlocked country in the Himalayan region in South Asia. It is bordered to the north by China, and to the south, east, and west by India.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Euro/US$. In January 1999, the Dutch Guilder became a participatory currency within euro system, the euro market rate became applicable to all transactions at the rate of 1 Euro = 2.20371 Dutch Guilder. In 2002, the Dutch Guilder was retired from calculations.
GENERAL_NOTES: The Netherlands is in North-West Europe. It borders the North Sea to the north and west, Belgium to the south, and Germany to the east, and water borders with Denmark, Norway and United Kingdom. It is a founding member of the European Union, G20 and OECD.

CURRENCY_NOTES: On March 1985, the NZ Dollar adopted a free floating exchange rate regime. However, there were several attempts of government interventions to avoid dramatic fluctuation during 2007-2008.
GENERAL_NOTES: New Zealand is an in the south-western Pacific Ocean. New Zealand is situated southeast of the Tasman Sea closed to Australia. The closest neighbours to the north are New Caledonia, Fiji and Tonga. It is a member of OECD, APEC, ANZUS, and Pacific Island Forum, East Asia Summit.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Nicaraguan C??rdoba/ US$. In 1988, the 2nd c??rdoba, equal to 1000 1st c??rdobas, was introduced. In 1991 the third c??rdoba was introduced, worth 5,000,000 2nd c??rdobas. A crawling Pegged exchange rate system is in effect
GENERAL_NOTES: Nicaragua is in Central America bordered by Honduras to the north and Costa Rica to the south; the Pacific Ocean to the west; the Caribbean Sea to the east. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in CFA franc/US$. Until 1999, the official rate was pegged to the French franc. In 1994, the CFA franc was devalued (100 CFC franc = Franc franc). Since January 1999, the CFC franc is pegged to the Euro at the rate of 655.957 per Euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: Niger is a landlocked country in Western Africa. It borders Nigeria and Benin to the south, Burkina Faso and Mali to the west, Algeria and Libya to the north and Chad to the east.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Nigerian Naira/ US$. The naira was introduced in 1973, replacing the pound at a rate of 2 naira = 1 pound. A managed float system is adopted and a multiple exchange rate system exists in many years.
GENERAL_NOTES: Nigeria is a federal constitutional republic comprising thirty-six states. It is located in West Africa and shares borders with the Republic of Benin to the west, Chad and Cameroon to the east, and Niger to the north. Its coast in the south lies on the Gulf of Guinea on the Atlantic Ocean. It is a member of OPEC.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Norway Crone/US$. In December 1992, the Central Bank of Norway abandoned the fixed exchange rate and adopt a floating exchange rate system due to the heavy speculation against the Norwegian currency.
GENERAL_NOTES: Norway is in the Northern Europe . It borders with Sweden to the east; Finland to the south and Russia to the east; and Denmark lies south of its southern tip across the Skagerrak Strait. Norway faces the North Atlantic Ocean and the Barents Sea. Norway is a founding member of the Council of Europe, and the Nordic Council, and is a member of the European Economic Area, and the OECD.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Omani Rial/ US$. The rate has been pegged to US$.
GENERAL_NOTES: Oman is an Arab country in the southwest Asia on the southeast coast of the Arabian Peninsula. It borders the United Arab Emirates on the northwest, Saudi Arabia on the west and Yemen on the south.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Pakistan Rupee/US$. In 1970s the rate was pegged to the US$. Then a managed floating rate system was adopted. A floating system is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Pakistan is in South Asia bordered Afghanistan and Iran to the west, and India to the east and the China in the far northeast. It has a coastline along the Arabian Sea and Gulf of Oman in the south.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in US$. The balboa is the Panamanian currency fixed at parity with the US$ since independence in 1903. In practice, however, the country is dollarized and uses the US$ for all its paper currency.
GENERAL_NOTES: Panama is in Central America connecting North and South America, it borders Costa Rica to the northwest, Colombia to the southeast, the Caribbean Sea to the north and the Pacific Ocean to the south. The Panama Canal was built by the US Army Corps of Engineers between 1904 and 1914. In 1977, an agreement was signed for the complete transfer of the Canal from the US to Panama by the end of the century. A significant share of its GDP is from revenue from Canal tolls. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Kina/US$. kina was introduced in 1975, replacing the Australian dollar at par. It is allowed float independently with respect to the US$.
GENERAL_NOTES: Papua New Guinea is in Oceania, occupying the eastern half of the island of New Guinea and numerous offshore islands (the western portion of the island is a part of the Indonesian provinces of Papua and West Papua). It is located in the south-western Pacific Ocean. it is a member of APEC.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Paraguay Guarani. Between 1960 and 1985, the Guaran?? was pegged to the United States dollar at 126 Guarani to 1 USD. From early 1998, a managed float system is adopted. Prior to 1998, free market rate was adopted.
GENERAL_NOTES: Paraguay is a landlocked country in South America bordered by Argentina to the south and southwest, Brazil to the east and northeast, and Bolivia to the northwest.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Peruvian Nuevo Sol/ US$. Due to the bad economic performance in the 1980s and hyperinflation in the late 1980s, on February 1985 the inti equal to 1000 soles was introduced. On July 1991, the inti was replaced by the nuevo sol at a rate of 1 nuevo sol = 1,000,000 intis. Currently, a floating exchange rate regime is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Peru is in western South America bordered on the north by Ecuador and Colombia, on the east by Brazil, on the southeast by Bolivia, on the south by Chile, and on the west by the Pacific Ocean.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Philippine Peso/US$. The Asian Financial Crisis in 1997 has affected peso hardly. The rate is allowed to float independently; however the authorities intervene when necessary.
GENERAL_NOTES: The Philippines is a country in Southeast Asia in the western Pacific Ocean. Taiwan lies to the north and Vietnam lies to the West. The island of Borneo and other islands of Indonesia lie to the south. It is bounded on the east by the Philippine Sea. It is member of East Asia summit, APEC and ASEAN.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Polish New Zloty/ US$. As a result of inflation in the early 1990s, in 1995, the zloty is redenominated at 10,000 old zloty to one new zloty. The rate is allowed to float freely.
GENERAL_NOTES: Poland is a transition country in Central Europe bordered by Germany to the west; the Czech Republic and Slovakia to the south; Ukraine, Belarus and Lithuania to the east; and the Baltic Sea and Kaliningrad Oblast, a Russian exclave, to the north. Poland is a member of the European Union, G-20 and OECD.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed Euro/US$. The escudo was the currency before introducing the Euro in 1999.
GENERAL_NOTES: Portugal is located in south-western Europe on the Iberian Peninsula. Portugal borders the Atlantic Ocean to the west and south and by Spain to the north and east. The Atlantic archipelagos of the Azores and Madeira are also part of Portugal. Portugal is a member of the European Union (joined the then European Economic Community in 1986 that became the European union), G-20 and a founding member of the Latin Union, the Organization of Ibero-American States, the OECD, the Community of Portuguese Language Countries, the European Union's Euro zone, and also a Schengen state.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Qatari Rial/ US$. Until 1973, Qatar and Dubai jointly issued the riyal. However, following Dubai's entrance into the United Arab Emirates, Qatar began issuing the Qatari riyal separate from Dubai. The rate is pegged to the US$ at 3.64 Rial per US$.
GENERAL_NOTES: Qatar is an Arab emirate in the Middle East, occupying the small Qatar Peninsula on the north-easterly coast of the much larger Arabian Peninsula. It borders Saudi Arabia to the south. Other sides are boarded by the Persian Gulf. It is a member of OPEC.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Romanian New Leu/US$. On July 2005, The currency is revalued at 10000 previous leu to a new leu. It adopts a floating system. However, in early years, it was pegged ( to US$ or SRD or to a weighted basket of currencies).
GENERAL_NOTES: Romania is in Europe bordered by Black Sea to the east; Hungary and Serbia to the west; Ukraine and the Republic of Moldova to the northeast; and Bulgaria to the south. Romania is a transition country. It joined the European Union in 2007 and a member of G-20.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Russian Ruble/ US$. The ruble is the currency of the Russian Federation and the former soviet Union. In 1998 redenomination took place (at the rate of 1 new ruble = 1000 old ruble).
GENERAL_NOTES: Russia is in northern Eurasia. Russia shares borders with Norway, Finland, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania and Poland, Belarus, Ukraine, Georgia, Azerbaijan, Kazakhstan, China, Mongolia, and North Korea. It shares maritime borders with Japan by the Sea of Okhotsk, and the U.S. state of Alaska across the Bering Strait. Russia is the largest country in the world.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Rwanda Franc/US$. Before March 1995 the rate is pegged to US$ and then adopted a market determined rate system. However the authorities intervened to influence the rate Currently it has Crawl-like arrangement.
GENERAL_NOTES: Rwanda is a landlocked country located in the eastern-central Africa, bordered by Uganda, Burundi, the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Tanzania. Rwanda's economy suffered heavily during the 1994 genocide, with widespread loss of life, failure to maintain infrastructure, and neglect of important cash crops causing a large drop in investment and GDP.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Tala/ US$. The tala remained equal to the New Zealand dollar until 1975. It has been pegged to a weighted basket of currencies of its main trading partners.
GENERAL_NOTES: Samoa formerly known as Western Samoa, is an Island nation governing the western part of the Samoan Islands in the South Pacific Ocean. The closest countries are Hawaii and New Zealand.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in S??o Tom?? and Pr??ncipe Dobra/ US$. Since January 2010, this has been pegged to EURO.
GENERAL_NOTES: S??o Tom?? and Pr??ncipe is an island nation in the Gulf of Guinea, off the western equatorial coast of Africa.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Saudi Riyal/ US$. The rate is pegged to the US$.
GENERAL_NOTES: Saudi Arabia is the largest Arab country of the Middle East. It borders Jordan and Iraq to the north and northeast, Kuwait, Qatar, Bahrain and the United Arab Emirates to the east, Oman to the southeast, and Yemen to the south. It is a member of OPEC.
