CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in CFA franc/US$. Until 1999, the official rate was pegged to the French franc. In 1994, the CFA franc was devalued (100 CFC franc = Franc franc). Since January 1999, the CFC franc has been pegged to the Euro at the rate of 655.957 per Euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: Senegal is in western Africa. Senegal is bounded by the Atlantic Ocean to the west, Mauritania to the north, Mali to the east, and Guinea and Guinea-Bissau to the south; The Gambia, on the north, east and south.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Serbian Dinar/ US$. In 2003, the Serbian dinar replaced the Yugoslav dinar at par as Yugoslavia was transformed into the State Union of Serbia and Montenegro.
GENERAL_NOTES: Serbia, a former state of Yugoslavia is located at the crossroads of Central and Southeast Europe. it is a landlocked bordered by Hungary to the north; Romania and Bulgaria to the east; Macedonia to the south; and Croatia, Bosnia, and Montenegro to the west; Albania through the disputed region of Kosovo. It claimed independence in 2008. Serbia is a member of the UN, Council of Europe, OSCE, BSEC and CEFTA.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Seychellois Rupee/ US$. Before May 1996, it is pegged to the SDR. Until 2008 it was pegged to a weighted basket of currencies. Now a floating system is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Seychelles is an island country spanning an archipelago of 115 islands in the Indian Ocean; some of them are 1,500 kilometres east of mainland Africa, northeast of the island of Madagascar.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Sierra Leone Leone/ US$. It is allowed to float independently.
GENERAL_NOTES: Sierra Leone is in West Africa bordered by Guinea to the north and east, Liberia to the southeast, and the Atlantic Ocean to the west and southwest. The country was on a Civil war during 1991-2000.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Singapore Dollar/ US$. A managed floating system with no determined path is in effect. The Brunei dollar is also a legal tender at par.
GENERAL_NOTES: Singapore is an island country off the southern tip of the Malay Peninsula, in the Southeast Asian region of the Asian continent. It is separated from Malaysia by the Straits of Johor to its north, and from Indonesia's Riau Islands by the Singapore Strait to its south. It is a member of ASEAN. APEC, and the East Asia summit.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Euro/ US$. The Slovak koruna (Slovak crown) was the currency of Slovakia between February 1993 and December 2008. The koruna has been replaced by the euro on January 2009 (at a rate of 30.1260 korunas to the euro)
GENERAL_NOTES: The Slovak Republic is a landlocked country in Central Europe. It was formed after dissolving Czechoslovakia in 1993. Slovakia is bordered by the Czech Republic and Austria to the west, Poland to the north, Ukraine to the east and Hungary to the south. Slovakia is a member state of the European Union, NATO, United Nations, OECD and WTO among others.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Euro/ US$. On October 1991, the Tolar was introduced to replace Yugoslav dinar at parity. On June 2004, the tolar was pegged to the euro. On July 2006, The Euro has been introduced by replacing tolar at the rate of 239.640 tolar per euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: Slovenia is in Central Europe bordering Italy on the west, Austria on the north, Croatia on the south and southeast and Hungary on the northeast. In 1991, Slovenia split from Yugoslavia and became an independent country. It is a member of the European Union and NATO. It joint the Eurozone and the OECD as well.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Solomon Island dollar/ US$.
GENERAL_NOTES: Solomon Islands is a state of Oceania, located in east of Papua New Guinea, consisting nearly one thousand islands. It is a member of the Commonwealth of Nations. It gained independence in 1976. Ethnic tensions led a civil war during 2000-2003.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Somali Shilling/ US$. Currently the Somali shilling is the official currency of Somaliland which is recognized internationally as an autonomous region of Somalia.
GENERAL_NOTES: Somalia is located in the Horn of Africa bordered by Ethiopia to the west, Djibouti to the northwest, the Gulf of Aden to the north, the Indian Ocean to the east, and Kenya to the southwest. Since 1991, it has faced a longstanding Civil War which left the country without a central government for several years.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in rand/US$. The rand is the currency of the Common Monetary Area between South Africa, Swaziland and Lesotho. Although Namibia withdrew from the Common Monetary Area, the rand is still a legal tender. This is allowed float independently; However in 1970s it was pegged to US$. A dual rate system was in effect until February 1983 and between September 1985- March 1995.
GENERAL_NOTES: South Africa is located at the southern tip of Africa, with a coastline on the Atlantic and Indian Oceans. It borders Namibia, Botswana and Zimbabwe to the north; to the east are Mozambique and Swaziland to the east. Lesotho is wholly surrounded by South Africa. It is a founding member of the African Union, and a member of the Commonwealth of Nations, Antarctic Treaty System, Group of 77, South Atlantic Peace and Cooperation Zone, Southern African Customs Union G20 and G8+5.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Euro/ US$. The peseta was replaced by the euro in 2002, following the establishment of Euro in 1999. The exchange rate was 1 Euro = 166.386 peseta.
GENERAL_NOTES: Spain is in south-western Europe on the Iberian Peninsula. Its mainland is bordered to the south and east by the Mediterranean Sea except for a small land boundary with the British Overseas Territory of Gibraltar; to the north by France, Andorra, and the Bay of Biscay; and to the northwest and west by the Atlantic Ocean and Portugal. Spanish territory also includes the Balearic Islands in the Mediterranean, the Canary Islands in the Atlantic Ocean off the African coast, and two autonomous cities in North Africa, Ceuta and Melilla, that border Morocco. Spain is a member of the European Union, G20 and OECD.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Sri Lankan Rupee/US$. It was allowed to float independently with interventions to minimize fluctuations for several years. However, from February 2005, a floating system is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Sri Lanka is an island in South Asia, surrounded by the Indian Ocean. India is the nearest country which is a sea boundary to the north, and Maldives lies in vicinity. Until 1972, it is known as Ceylon. Sri Lanka faced a civil war lasted for nearly three decades from 1983-2009.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Since 1976, this has been pegged to the United States: US$1 = EC$2.70.
GENERAL_NOTES: Saint Kitts and Nevis is islands in the Caribbean Sea, located between Puerto Rico and Trinidad and Tobago. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Since 1976, this has been pegged to the United States: US$1 = EC$2.70.
GENERAL_NOTES: Saint Lucia is an island in the eastern Caribbean Sea on the boundary with the Atlantic Ocean and located north/northeast of the islands of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, northwest of Barbados and south of Martinique. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Since 1976, this has been pegged to the United States: US$1 = EC$2.70.
GENERAL_NOTES: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines are Caribbean islands located at the southern end of the eastern border of the Caribbean Sea where the latter meets the Atlantic Ocean. This has a chain of islands stretching south from Saint Vincent Island to Grenada. To the north of St. Vincent lies St. Lucia, to the east Barbados. The country has a French and British colonial history and is a member of Commonwealth of Nations, and CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Pound /US$. On July 1999, the dinar equal to 10 old pounds was introduced. On July 2007, the pound replaced the dinar at a rate of 1 pound = 100 dinar. In 1992 a unified exchange rate system was introduced. Under this system, the exchange rate is determined by a committee of local bankers without official intervention. A managed floating system with no pre-determined path is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Sudan is in north-eastern Africa. It is bordered by Egypt to the north, the Red Sea to the northeast, Eritrea and Ethiopia to the east, Kenya and Uganda to the southeast, the Democratic Republic of the Congo and the Central African Republic to the southwest, Chad to the west and Libya to the northwest. The Nile river divides the country between east and west sides.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Surinamese Dollar/ US$. The Suriname dollar replaced the Surinamese guilder on 1 January 2004, with one dollar equal to 1000 guilders. Now a stabilized arrangement is in effect. A multiple rate system is also applied.
GENERAL_NOTES: Suriname is in South America bordered by French Guiana to the east; Guyana to the west; Brazil to the south; the Atlantic coast to the north. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Lilangeni/US$. The Lilangeni was introduced in 1974 at par with the South African rand through the Common Monetary Area, and remains tied at a one-to-one exchange rate.
GENERAL_NOTES: Eswatini, formerly known in English as Swaziland, officially renamed in 2018, is a landlocked country in Southern Africa, bordered to the north, south and west by South Africa, and to the east by Mozambique. It is a member of Southern African Customs Union.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Swedish Krona/US$. Prior to May 1991, the official rate was pegged to an index of a basket of currencies. From May 1991 to November 1992, the rate was pegged to the European currency unit (ECU). Since November 1992, It has been allowed to float freely.
GENERAL_NOTES: Sweden is in Northern Europe. Sweden borders Norway to the west and Finland to the northeast, and water borders with Denmark, Germany and Poland to the south and Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania and Russia to the east. Sweden is also connected to Denmark by a bridge-tunnel across the ??resund. It is a member of the European Union, G20 and OECD.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Swiss Franc/US$.
GENERAL_NOTES: Switzerland is a landlocked country situated in Western Europe. It borders Germany to the north, France to the west, Italy to the south, and Austria and Liechtenstein to the east. This country has a long history of neutrality-it has not participated in a international war since 1815-and did not join the United Nations until 2002. Switzerland is home to many international organisations, including the second largest UN office, the World Trade Organization (WTO), and the World Economic Forum. It was a founder of the European Free Trade Association and is part of the Schengen Agreement although it is notably not a member of the European Union, nor the European Economic Area. It is a member of OECD.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Syrian Pound/US$. A managed system is in effect. A multiple exchange rate system has been in effect. The principal rate has been pegged to the US$.
GENERAL_NOTES: Syrian Arab Republic is in Western Asia, bordering Lebanon and the Mediterranean Sea to the West, Turkey to the north, Iraq to the east, Jordan to the south, and Israel to the southwest.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Somoni/ US$. Tajikistan used the Russian ruble a few years after independence. On May 1995, the Tajikistani ruble replaced the Russian ruble at a rate of 1 Tajikistani ruble : 100 Russian rubles. Due to prolong inflation and economic problems after its independence, On October 2000, the somoni were introduced to replaced the ruble at the rate of 1 somoni : 1000 rubles.
GENERAL_NOTES: Tajikistan is a landlocked country in Central Asia bordering Afghanistan to the south, Uzbekistan to the west, Kyrgyzstan to the north, and China to the east. After independence, Tajikistan faced a civil war lasted from 1992 to 1997.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Tanzania Shilling/ US$. The rate is determined independently while the authorities intervene when necessary.
GENERAL_NOTES: Tanzania is in central East Africa bordered by Kenya and Uganda to the north, Rwanda, Burundi and the Democratic Republic of the Congo to the west, and Zambia, Malawi and Mozambique to the south. The country's eastern borders lie on the Indian Ocean.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Thailand Baht/US$. A floating system is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Thailand is in Southeast Asia. It is bordered to the north by Myanmar and Laos, to the east by Laos and Cambodia, to the south by the Gulf of Thailand and Malaysia, and to the west by the Andaman Sea and the southern extremity of Burma. It is a member of ASEAN, APEC and the East Asia summit.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in CFA franc/US$. Until 1999, the official rate was pegged to the French franc. In 1994, the CFA franc was devalued (100 CFC franc = Franc franc). Since January 1999, the CFC franc has been pegged to the Euro at the rate of 655.957 per Euro.
GENERAL_NOTES: Togo is located in West Africa bordered by Ghana to the west, Benin to the east and Burkina Faso to the north. It extends south to the Gulf of Guinea.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Until 11 February 1991, the pa'anga was pegged to the Australian dollar at par. Now it has a pegged exchange rate within a horizontal bands.
GENERAL_NOTES: Tonga is an Island nations in the South Pacific Ocean, comprises 169 islands, 36 of them are inhabited. It is located at about a third of the distance from New Zealand to Hawaii.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed Trinidad and Tobago Dollar/ US$. Until April 1993, it was pegged to the US$. Then it is market -determined. Now a stabilized arrangement is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Trinidad and Tobago are Caribbean Islands, lying northeast of Venezuela and south of Grenada and shares maritime boundaries with Barbados to the northeast, Guyana to the southeast, and Venezuela to the south and west. It is a member of CARICOM.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Tunisian Dinar/US$. A Crawl-like arrangement is adopted. However, during 1970s and 1980s, the rate was pegged to a weighted basket of currencies.
GENERAL_NOTES: Tunisia is in northern Africa. It is bordered by Algeria to the west, Libya to the southeast, and Mediterranean Sea to the north and east. Tunisia has an association agreement with European Union. It is also a member of the Arab League and the African union.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Turkish Lira (Second Turkish Lira) /US$. On January 2005, the currency was redenominated: 1,000,000 the first Turkish Lira to 1 second Turkish Lira. Until January 2009, the second Turkish lira was called as new Turkish Lira. The rate is allowed to float freely, but the authorities have rights to intervene.
GENERAL_NOTES: Turkey is a Eurasian country bordered by eight countries: Bulgaria to the northwest; Greece to the west; Georgia to the northeast; Armenia, Azerbaijan and Iran to the east; and Iraq and Syria to the southeast. The Mediterranean Sea and Cyprus are to the south; the Aegean Sea to the west; and the Black Sea is to the north. Turkey is a member of Council of Europe, G-20, OECD and the G-20 and the European Union ( 2005). It has been an associate member of the European Economic Community since 1963 and have reached a customs union agreement in 1995.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Ugandan Shilling/US$. Due to high inflation, a new shilling was introduced in 1987 to replace old shilling at the rate of 1 new shilling : 100 old shillings. Recent years the rate is allowed to float independently; however different regimes were adopted from time to time. In addition, Some years, several exchange rate systems have been in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Uganda is a landlocked country in East Africa bordered on the east by Kenya, on the north by Sudan, on the west by the Democratic Republic of the Congo, on the southwest by Rwanda, and on the south by Tanzania. A part of the south covers by Lake Victoria, which shares borders with Kenya and Tanzania. It is a member of the African Union, the Commonwealth of Nations, Organization of the Islamic Conference and East African Community.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Hryvnia/ US$. The hryvnia has been the national currency of Ukraine since 1996. The hryvnia introduced in 1996 to replace the karbovanets , at a rate of 1 hryvnia = 100,000 karbovantsiv due to hyperinflation.
GENERAL_NOTES: Ukraine is in Eastern Europe bordering the Russia to the east and northeast, Belarus to the northwest, Poland, Slovakia and Hungary to the west, Romania and Moldova to the southwest, and the Black Sea and Sea of Azov to the south and southeast. It became independent in 1991 from the Soviet Union.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in UAE Dirham/US$. In 1978, the dirham was officially pegged to the IMF's Special Drawing Rights (SDR). In practice, it is pegged to the U.S. dollar for most of the time. Since November 1997, the dirham has been pegged to the 1 U.S. dollar = 3.6725 dirhams.
GENERAL_NOTES: The United Arab Emirates is a federation of seven emirates situated in the southeast of the Arabian Peninsula in Southwest Asia on the Persian Gulf, bordering Oman and Saudi Arabia. The UAE consists of seven states known as emirates: Abu Dhabi, Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Umm al-Quwain, Ras al-Khaimah and Fujairah. It is a member of OPEC.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in British Pound/US$. The rate is allowed to float independently.
GENERAL_NOTES: The United Kingdom is a constitutional monarchy and a unitary state consisting of four countries: England, Northern Ireland, Scotland and Wales. It is an Island located off the north-western coast of continental Europe. Northern Ireland has a land border with Republic of Ireland and the rest of UK is surrounded by the Atlantic Ocean, the North Sea, the English Channel and the Irish Sea. Great Britain is linked to France by the Channel Tunnel. The UK has fourteen overseas territories that are not constitutionally part of the UK. It is a Member of the European Union, a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council, a member of the Commonwealth of Nations, G8, G20, and OECD.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in US$/US$. The rate is allowed to float independently. The US$ is the official currency of the United States, Zimbabwe, Palau, Marshall Islands, El Salvador, British Virgin Islands, Ecuador, and Federated States of Micronesia.
GENERAL_NOTES: The United States is a federal constitutional republic comprising fifty states and a federal district. The country is situated mostly in central North America, lie between the Pacific and Atlantic Oceans, bordered by Canada to the north and Mexico to the south. The state of Alaska is in the northwest of the continent, with Canada to the east and Russia to the west across the Bering Strait. The state of Hawaii is an archipelago in the mid-Pacific. The country also possesses several territories in the Caribbean and Pacific. It is a member of G8, G20, OECD, APEC, ANZUS and East Asia summit.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Uruguay Peso/US. In November 1973, the peso was replaced by the nuevo peso (new peso) at a rate of 1 new peso for 1000 old pesos. Due to inflation, the peso replaced the nuevo peso in March, 1993, again at a rate of 1 new for 1000 old. Since June 2002, a float rate regime has been changed to a floating system. However the authorities intervene when necessary.
GENERAL_NOTES: Uruguay is in the south-eastern part of South America bordered by Brazil to the north; Argentina to the southwest; Atlantic Ocean to the southeast.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Uzbekistan Som/ US$. Uzbekistan continued using Soviet ruble after independence. The ruble is replaced by som at par on November 1993. On July 1994, a second som was introduced at a rate of 1 new som = 1000 old som and 1 U.S. dollar was equal to 25 som.
GENERAL_NOTES: Uzbekistan is a doubly landlocked country in Central Asia bordering Kazakhstan to the west and to the north, Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan to the east, and Afghanistan and Turkmenistan to the south. It became independent in 1991 from the former Soviet Union.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Vanuatu Vatu/ US$. The vatu was introduced in 1982, after independence, to replace the New Hebrides franc at par. This helps the end the official circulation of the Australian dollar in Vanuatu.
GENERAL_NOTES: Vanuatu is an island nation located in the South Pacific Ocean. It is situated 1,750 kilometres east of northern Australia, 500 kilometres northeast of New Caledonia, west of Fiji, and southeast of the Solomon Islands.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Venezuela Bolivar/US$. Due to inflation, on January 2008, the bol??var fuerte replaced the bol??var at the rate of Bolivar 1 = bol??var fuerte 1,000. It is pegged to the US$; however throughout the history rates has been determined by different rate regimes. In some years, several exchange rates were in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Venezuela is on the northern coast of South America. Venezuela borders Guyana to the east; Brazil to the south; and Colombia to the west; Trinidad and Tobago, Grenada, St. Lucia, Barbados, Cura??ao, Bonaire, Aruba, Saint Vincent and the Grenadines; and the Leeward Antilles to the north. It is a founding member of OPEC.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Viet Nam Dong/ US$. The Dong was introduced in 1978. A Stabilized arrangement is in effect. In early year, the rate was pegged either to the US$ or the SDR. We use AMA exchange rates from UNDATAbase. This includes IMF-based rates and PAREs (Price adjusted rates of exchange) which are calculated by UNSD. PAREs are applied when there is a serious disparity between real GDP growth and growth when GDP was converted to United states dollars using IMF-based rates.
GENERAL_NOTES: Vietnam is in Southeast Asia. It is bordered by China to the north, Laos to the northwest, Cambodia to the southwest, and the South China Sea to the east. It is member of ASEAN, APEC and the East Asia summit.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Express in Yemeni Rial/ US$. During the transitional period after the unification of North and South in 1990, both the northern rial and the southern dinar remained legal tender at the rate of 1 dinar =r 26 rials. On June 1996, the dinar was withdrawn from circulation.
GENERAL_NOTES: The Republic of Yemen is in Western Asia bordered by Saudi Arabia to the north, the Red Sea to the west, the Gulf of Aden and Arabian Sea to the south, and Oman to the east. Yemeni unification took place on 22 May 1990, when North Yemen was united with South Yemen, forming the Republic of Yemen.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in Zambian new Kwacha/US$. A floating system is in effect.
GENERAL_NOTES: Zambia a landlocked country in Southern Africa. The bordering countries are the Democratic Republic of the Congo to the north, Tanzania to the north-east, Malawi to the east, Mozambique, Zimbabwe, Botswana, and Namibia to the south, and Angola to the west.

CURRENCY_NOTES: Expressed in US$. The Zimbabwe dollar has been the legal tender until June 2009. currently, no separate legal tender exists.
GENERAL_NOTES: Zimbabwe is a landlocked country located in the southern part of the continent of Africa. It is bordered by South Africa to the south, Botswana to the southwest, Zambia to the northwest and Mozambique to the east.
